result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy L. Wilder

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:47 AM cases 20CF1439, 20CF1517, 20CM342, 22CF951, 22CM462, 22CT57 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tammy L. Wilder in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Tammy L. Wilder. Court enters not guilty pleas on behalf of the Defendant. Court notes that majority of the cases are assigned to Branch 2 and orders they all be heard together. 

Branch 2 for scheduling.

10:14 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tammy L. Wilder in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant states she has representation on other matters. Court advises that she contact her attorney to discuss this new matter.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.

11:22 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tammy L. Wilder in court without counsel. 
Defendant ordered to be fingerprinted today. Waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates their address. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6-29-22 at 2:00 PM. 
Return to court: 7-20-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
